body.p:
Maysville31st Aug 1863,
The Honorable of the Secretary of State,State of Ky
Dear Sir --

Some four or five weeks ago I addressed to his Excellency the of Kentucky, a Petition, numerously Signed by the most respectable citizens of Maysville, praying for the remission of a fine most unjustly imposed upon me as a Tavern Keeper (when I kept no Tavern); and which was inflicted as I contend without any just Cause. It is not only the amount of the fine which is but $20, but the Governorinjustice of it which renders me anxious to have it remitted --

I have received no answer to the said petition, but have been informed that such matters are usually referred to the Secretary of State, and I suppose the Governor, among more important matters may have overlooked it If you will take the trouble to inform me of the fate of the petition you will place me under obligations

A. McDonald
In relation to petition not acted upon
